trans-unit.source: Follow these best practices for geofencing in your app.
trans-unit.target: Follow these best practices for geofencing in your app.

trans-unit.source: Guidelines for geofencing apps
trans-unit.target: Guidelines for geofencing apps

trans-unit.source: Guidelines for geofencing apps
trans-unit.target: Guidelines for geofencing apps

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Geofence class (XAML)
trans-unit.target: Geofence class (XAML)

trans-unit.source: Geolocator class (XAML)
trans-unit.target: Geolocator class (XAML)

trans-unit.source: Follow these best practices for [**geofencing**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263744) in your app.
trans-unit.target: Follow these best practices for [**geofencing**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263744) in your app.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: If your app will need internet access when a [**Geofence**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263587) event occurs, check for internet access before creating the geofence.
trans-unit.target: If your app will need internet access when a [**Geofence**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263587) event occurs, check for internet access before creating the geofence.

trans-unit.source: If the app doesn't currently have internet access, you can prompt the user to connect to the internet before you set up the geofence.
trans-unit.target: If the app doesn't currently have internet access, you can prompt the user to connect to the internet before you set up the geofence.

trans-unit.source: If internet access isn't possible, avoid consuming the power required for the geofencing location checks.
trans-unit.target: If internet access isn't possible, avoid consuming the power required for the geofencing location checks.

trans-unit.source: Ensure the relevance of geofencing notifications by checking the time stamp and current location when a geofence event indicates changes to an [**Entered**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263660) or **Exited** state.
trans-unit.target: Ensure the relevance of geofencing notifications by checking the time stamp and current location when a geofence event indicates changes to an [**Entered**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263660) or **Exited** state.

trans-unit.source: See [Checking the time stamp and current location](#timestamp) below for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Checking the time stamp and current location](#timestamp) below for more information.

trans-unit.source: Create exceptions to manage cases when a device can't access location info, and notify the user if necessary.
trans-unit.target: Create exceptions to manage cases when a device can't access location info, and notify the user if necessary.

trans-unit.source: Location info may be unavailable because permissions are turned off, the device doesn't contain a GPS radio, the GPS signal is blocked, or the Wi-Fi signal isn't strong enough.
trans-unit.target: Location info may be unavailable because permissions are turned off, the device doesn't contain a GPS radio, the GPS signal is blocked, or the Wi-Fi signal isn't strong enough.

trans-unit.source: In general, it isn't necessary to listen for geofence events in the foreground and background at the same time.
trans-unit.target: In general, it isn't necessary to listen for geofence events in the foreground and background at the same time.

trans-unit.source: However, if your app needs to listen for geofence events in both the foreground and background:
trans-unit.target: However, if your app needs to listen for geofence events in both the foreground and background:

trans-unit.source: Call the [**ReadReports**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263633) method to find out if an event has occurred.
trans-unit.target: Call the [**ReadReports**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263633) method to find out if an event has occurred.

trans-unit.source: Unregister your foreground event listener when your app isn't visible to the user and re-register when it becomes visible again.
trans-unit.target: Unregister your foreground event listener when your app isn't visible to the user and re-register when it becomes visible again.

trans-unit.source: See [Background and foreground listeners](#background-and-foreground-listeners) for code examples and more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Background and foreground listeners](#background-and-foreground-listeners) for code examples and more information.

trans-unit.source: Don't use more than 1000 geofences per app.
trans-unit.target: Don't use more than 1000 geofences per app.

trans-unit.source: The system actually supports thousands of geofences per app, you can maintain good app performance to help reduce the app's memory usage by using no more than 1000.
trans-unit.target: The system actually supports thousands of geofences per app, you can maintain good app performance to help reduce the app's memory usage by using no more than 1000.

trans-unit.source: Don't create a geofence with a radius smaller than 50 meters.
trans-unit.target: Don't create a geofence with a radius smaller than 50 meters.

trans-unit.source: If your app needs to use a geofence with a small radius, advise users to use your app on a device with a GPS radio to ensure the best performance.
trans-unit.target: If your app needs to use a geofence with a small radius, advise users to use your app on a device with a GPS radio to ensure the best performance.

trans-unit.source: Additional usage guidance
trans-unit.target: Additional usage guidance

trans-unit.source: Checking the time stamp and current location
trans-unit.target: Checking the time stamp and current location

trans-unit.source: When an event indicates a change to an [**Entered**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263660) or **Exited** state, check both the time stamp of the event and your current location.
trans-unit.target: When an event indicates a change to an [**Entered**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263660) or **Exited** state, check both the time stamp of the event and your current location.

trans-unit.source: Various factors, such as the system not having enough resources to launch a background task, the user not noticing the notification, or the device being in standby (on Windows), may affect when the event is actually processed by the user.
trans-unit.target: Various factors, such as the system not having enough resources to launch a background task, the user not noticing the notification, or the device being in standby (on Windows), may affect when the event is actually processed by the user.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following sequence may occur:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following sequence may occur:

trans-unit.source: Your app creates a geofence and monitors the geofence for enter and exit events.
trans-unit.target: Your app creates a geofence and monitors the geofence for enter and exit events.

trans-unit.source: The user moves the device inside of the geofence, causing an enter event to be triggered.
trans-unit.target: The user moves the device inside of the geofence, causing an enter event to be triggered.

trans-unit.source: Your app sends a notification to the user that they are now inside the geofence.
trans-unit.target: Your app sends a notification to the user that they are now inside the geofence.

trans-unit.source: The user was busy and does not notice the notification until 10 minutes later.
trans-unit.target: The user was busy and does not notice the notification until 10 minutes later.

trans-unit.source: During that 10 minute delay, the user has moved back outside of the geofence.
trans-unit.target: During that 10 minute delay, the user has moved back outside of the geofence.

trans-unit.source: From the timestamp, you can tell that the action occurred in the past.
trans-unit.target: From the timestamp, you can tell that the action occurred in the past.

trans-unit.source: From the current location, you can see that the user is now back outside of the geofence.
trans-unit.target: From the current location, you can see that the user is now back outside of the geofence.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the functionality of your app, you may want to filter out this event.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the functionality of your app, you may want to filter out this event.

trans-unit.source: Background and foreground listeners
trans-unit.target: Background and foreground listeners

trans-unit.source: In general, your app doesn't need to listen for [**Geofence**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263587) events both in the foreground and in a background task at the same time.
trans-unit.target: In general, your app doesn't need to listen for [**Geofence**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263587) events both in the foreground and in a background task at the same time.

trans-unit.source: The cleanest method for handling a case where you might need both is to let the background task handle the notifications.
trans-unit.target: The cleanest method for handling a case where you might need both is to let the background task handle the notifications.

trans-unit.source: If you do set up both foreground and background geofence listeners, there is no guarantee which will be triggered first and so you must always call the [**ReadReports**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263633) method to find out if an event has occurred.
trans-unit.target: If you do set up both foreground and background geofence listeners, there is no guarantee which will be triggered first and so you must always call the [**ReadReports**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263633) method to find out if an event has occurred.

trans-unit.source: If you have set up both foreground and background geofence listeners, you should unregister your foreground event listener whenever your app is not visible to the user and re-register your app when it becomes visible again.
trans-unit.target: If you have set up both foreground and background geofence listeners, you should unregister your foreground event listener whenever your app is not visible to the user and re-register your app when it becomes visible again.

trans-unit.source: Here's some example code that registers for the visibility event.
trans-unit.target: Here's some example code that registers for the visibility event.

trans-unit.source: When the visibility changes, you can then enable or disable the foreground event handlers as shown here.
trans-unit.target: When the visibility changes, you can then enable or disable the foreground event handlers as shown here.

trans-unit.source: Sizing your geofences
trans-unit.target: Sizing your geofences

trans-unit.source: While GPS can provide the most accurate location info, geofencing can also use Wi-Fi or other location sensors to determine the user's current position.
trans-unit.target: While GPS can provide the most accurate location info, geofencing can also use Wi-Fi or other location sensors to determine the user's current position.

trans-unit.source: But using these other methods can affect the size of the geofences you can create.
trans-unit.target: But using these other methods can affect the size of the geofences you can create.

trans-unit.source: If the accuracy level is low, creating small geofences won't be useful.
trans-unit.target: If the accuracy level is low, creating small geofences won't be useful.

trans-unit.source: In general, it is recommended that you do not create a geofence with a radius smaller than 50 meters.
trans-unit.target: In general, it is recommended that you do not create a geofence with a radius smaller than 50 meters.

trans-unit.source: Also, geofence background tasks only run periodically on Windows; if you use a small geofence, there's a possibility that you could miss an [**Enter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263660) or **Exit** event entirely.
trans-unit.target: Also, geofence background tasks only run periodically on Windows; if you use a small geofence, there's a possibility that you could miss an [**Enter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263660) or **Exit** event entirely.

trans-unit.source: If your app needs to use a geofence with a small radius, advise users to use your app on a device with a GPS radio to ensure the best performance.
trans-unit.target: If your app needs to use a geofence with a small radius, advise users to use your app on a device with a GPS radio to ensure the best performance.
